page.title: 06Sainsbury's - Purley
page.content: Sainsbury's Supermarket is on the ground floor and sells fresh fish, meat, greengroceries and bread as well as tinned packaged and frozen foods. The Supermarket was built in 1980. The land was sold to Sainsbury's by Croydon Council on the condition that Sainsbury's provided a swimming pool and a car park. The average daily takings are Â£75,000-Â£100,000 and the supermarket is open six days a week. The swimming pool is very popular with local residents and cost 55p for children, 95p for adults. It has an eight floor multi-storey car park with an automatic barrier and cost 20p for a two hour stay. It has lifts and staircases and disabled people have parking near the lifts. Both the swimming pool and car park are run by Croydon Council.
